## Observation notes  
First documented by Handlirsch, 1891, with extensive historical record in the Pacific Maritime. Tommasi et al. 2004: <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Greater <span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span></span> Area</span>. Ratti et al. 2008: <span class="hl-place-name">Fraser Valley</span>. Biodiversity Galiano Life List: 1970, Galiano. Guzman et al., 2023: 2005; 2007; 2009, 2010; 2012; 2014, 2015; 2017, <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span> Is</span>land</span>. 2011, <span class="hl-place-name">Abbotsford</span>; 2013; 2015; 2016, <span class="hl-place-name">Lower Mainland</span>. NBSBC Bee Atlas Database: 2021; 2022, <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span> Is</span>land</span>, Saltspring; 2022, <span class="hl-place-name">Lower Mainland</span>, <span class="hl-place-name">Squamish</span>; 2023, <span class="hl-place-name">Greater <span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span></span>; <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span> Is</span>land</span>, 2023, <span class="hl-place-name">Galiano Island</span>. iNaturalist: widespread throughout the Pacific Maritime, from 2008.
